item.title: Python subprocess communication
item.description: Cheatsheet - Python subprocess communication Imports from subprocess import Popen, PIPE Imports for signals import signal, os Start process process = Popen(['./sum 50'], shell=True, stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE, stderr=PIPE) Check if process is alive def isAlive(process): poll = process.poll() if poll == None: print("Program running...") else: print("Program stopped :(") Read from stdout def getline(process): return "stdout : " + process.stdout.readline().decode('utf-8') Write to stdin process.stdin.write((str(i)+"\n").encode()) process.stdin.flush() Send signals os.kill(process.pid, signal.SIGSTOP) Available signals :
